newsitem.title: ROMANIA: ROMANIA MONTHLY INFLATION DROPS TO 6.9 PCT IN APR.
newsitem.headline: ROMANIA MONTHLY INFLATION DROPS TO 6.9 PCT IN APR.

text.p: Romanian monthly inflation slowed to 6.9 percent in April from a record post-communist high of 30.7 percent in March, the National Statistics Board (CNS) said on Friday.
It said year-on-year inflation went up to 176.8 percent last month from March's 164 percent, with consumer prices rising by 88.7 percent in April from December 1996.

Local economists say a recent move to increase by five times gas and heating prices starting May 1 to bring them to world levels is expected to trigger quicker inflation in May. But they say inflation would re-enter a downward path starting June or July.
The steep price rises earlier this year were triggered by the liberalisation of fuel, energy and food prices, a plank of the new centrist coalition government's reform programme.
The government aims to cut monthly inflation to 2.2 percent in the late months of 1997 after implementing tough reforms.
Year-on-year inflation this year was officialy forecast at 90 percent, but anlaysts said that figure was now beyond reach.
